Summary: Came upon us motionless in the sky...triangle information, encased in somewhat rectangular shadow and moved west to north east.
trends: There has been one other sighting in Albion
There were no other sightings in Albion on or around August 10th 2007
divs: sighting details it was a beatiful friday evening, august 10th, 2007. i believe it was the night in which leonides meteor shower would be best seen. at about 11:30 pm my wife and i stepped out to the back deck with eyes pierced toward the sky. an object appeared to my wife in the eastern sky.....just above the tree line. she stated, "what is that? oh, its a flock of geese." at this point it was know moving across the sky from east to north\nortwest.... i looked at what appeared to possibly be a flock of geese flying in a triangular formation as they sometimes do. but i immediately dismissed this notion. it was a very quiet night, i didn't hear the flapping of wings or any sound for that matter. it looked like dim lights moving across the sky, inaddion, the formation moved within a rectangular wavey\shadow....the object was trying to blend in with the night sky, as the rectangular formation wasn't easy to recognize, it also blocked stars behind it. it was not a flock of geese, a plane, or anything i had ever seen before. it was high enough to be a vey low flying plane, but again,it was complete silence. my instincts took over when i first noticed it, not what i thought it was, but what i knew what it wasn't....it was a very quick process of elimination. this all happened within a matter of 15 seconds. this doesn't sound like a lot of time, but i think time slows....like when the ground shakes during an earthquake.....it seems much longer than what it really was. your adrenaline kicks in and reactions times are stimulated. i immediately questioned my wife with statements, "that's not a flock of geese! what was that! i don't know what that was!" i was whispering these statements as if we were being watched, and she spoke in a normal voice, until i told her to whisper. i was a little worried, excited, and puzzled.... and wanted to know what just happened, why did we see this, is there a reason, are we being watched by visitors, could this be a military devise. i don't let this get to me, but today the questions still linger in the back of my head. as the object moved west, it vanished more so than it dissappeared into the distance.
